name: Battey, Michael S.
title: Co-Founder
notes: Over 35 years in financial services; previously Managing Director at Atlantic Trust Company's San Francisco office, Managing Director at Levensohn Venture Partners, General Partner at Pyramid Technology Secondary Fund LP, and Senior VP at Bessemer Trust Company. Began career as analyst for oil, gas, utility, and banking sectors at Chemical Bank and Bankers Trust in New York.

name: Behrendt, Richard John
title: Unknown
notes: San Francisco-area businessman; no detailed professional biography found in public records. A Richard Behrendt has a business registered in San Francisco, CA per D&B records.

name: Belushi, James
title: Actor, Comedian, Cannabis Farmer
notes: Born June 15, 1954; younger brother of John Belushi. Known for Saturday Night Live (1983-1985), the sitcom According to Jim (2001-2009), and films including Trading Places (1983) and K-9 (1989). Operates a cannabis farm in Oregon documented in the Discovery+ series Growing Belushi.
political_donations: Primarily Democratic donor; gave roughly 76% of $4,250 in contributions to Democrats. Endorsed President Obama's 2012 re-election.

name: Bertges, Jack R.
title: Senior Vice President, Commercial Lending
notes: Banking executive who joined New Resource Bank in 2007 after transferring to San Francisco in the mid-1980s in his role with Mellon Bank of Pittsburgh. His family's annual golf tournament has raised over $600,000 for the SF-Marin Food Bank over 20 years.
ngos: San Francisco Food Bank (Board Member); Hanna Boys Center, Sonoma (Board); Rose Court, San Francisco (Board); San Francisco Baykeeper (Advisory Board)

name: Breen, Kevin J.
employer: Law Office of Kevin William Breen
title: Attorney
notes: San Francisco attorney with over 43 years of general practice experience, licensed by the California State Bar (Bar No. 100361). Office located at 1005 Sansome St, Suite 330, San Francisco, CA 94111.

name: Bulotti, Richard C.
title: Former President
notes: California-based executive based in Nevada City, CA. Previously served as President of Nevada County United Way; worked in banking in California including ties to Placer Sierra Bank and Nevada City community.
ngos: Nevada County United Way (Former President)

name: Bush, Michael J.
employer: Great Place To Work Institute / UKG
title: CEO, Great Place To Work
notes: Global CEO of Great Place To Work since 2015, leading the firm that produces the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For list. Previously CEO of Tetra Tech Communications (grew revenues from $40M to $300M) and Clark Sustainable Resource Developments. Stanford Graduate School of Business MS (1994). Former member of President Obama's White House Business Council.
ngos: Inner City Advisors (Board, 2002-2012); Fund Good Jobs (Founding Board Member)

name: Foscue, Charles T.
employer: HAI Financial, Inc. / Advanced Lubrication Technology, Inc.
title: Founder and CEO, HAI Financial; Chairman and CEO, Advanced Lubrication Technology
notes: Known as 'Tom' Foscue; UNC Economics BA and Harvard MBA. Navy combat veteran (two Vietnam tours). Founded HAI Financial, Inc. in 1978, spending 40 years as an investment banker specializing in venture capital, M&A, IPO consulting, and debt financing. Also chairman/CEO of Advanced Lubrication Technology Inc.
ngos: Doheny Eye Institute (Chairman of the Board of Directors since 2019; board member since 2001)

name: Friedman, Jerry
title: Principal
notes: San Francisco-based real estate professional with an office at 3301 Lyon St, San Francisco, CA. Limited public biographical information available.

name: Furlotti, Alexander
title: President
notes: Born April 21, 1948 in Milan, Italy; admitted to California Bar 1973. Career as real estate developer and attorney: associate at Alexander, Inman, Kravetz & Tanzer in Beverly Hills (1973-1980), partner at Kravetz & Furlotti (1981-1983), then president of Quorum Properties and Quorum Funds in Los Angeles. Now heads Aeneas Enterprises LLC.
ngos: LA Opera Company (Board of Directors); Harvard-Westlake School (Trustee, 1989-1997); Yosemite National Institute (Trustee, 1990-1992); Urban Land Institute (Member)

name: Gardner, Robert K.
title: CEO / Principal
notes: San Francisco-based corporate crisis communications and public affairs executive. Robert K. Gardner has been associated with The Advocacy Group, a San Francisco firm specializing in corporate crisis communications.

name: Hammer, Joseph W.
title: Unknown
notes: No clear match found for Joseph W. Hammer with a confirmed Bohemian Club connection. A Joseph Hammer was appointed CEO of Expion360 (Nasdaq: XPON) in October 2025, but that individual's primary location is the Pacific Northwest.

name: Hammonds, William E.
title: Vistage Chair; Chairman, Hammonds Holding Co.
notes: San Francisco-based entrepreneur and management expert with 33+ years of experience. Co-founded Suncoast Savings, a Florida-based publicly traded mortgage banking firm (grew to 500 employees, $3B+ mortgages/yr). Has served as attorney, General Counsel, COO, and President of two public companies. Chairs Vistage International CEO peer advisory groups.

name: Janes, William S.
title: Managing Partner
notes: Managing Partner at Iron Point Partners, a private equity firm specializing in real estate and real assets investments across North America and Europe, founded 2007. Previously a Partner at Oak Hill Realty and held roles at Lincoln Property Management and Coldwell Banker. BA from Bowdoin College.

name: Klein, Michael D.
title: Unknown
notes: No specific public professional biography located for a Michael D. Klein definitively linked to the Bohemian Club's Ye Merrie Yowls camp. Multiple prominent executives named Michael Klein exist (Churchill Capital, Cooley LLP).

name: Le Masters, Earle III
title: Unknown
notes: The name corresponds to a Los Angeles-based individual; public records show an Earle H. LeMasters III associated with address in Los Angeles, CA. Earle H. LeMasters was historical chairman of the board of Pacific National Bank of San Francisco (1967 records). Earle LeMasters III's specific current professional role is not confirmed in public sources.

name: Lee, Chien
title: Founder and Chairman
notes: Born in Hong Kong; member of the founding Lee family of Hysan Development Company. Holds BS in Mathematical Science, MS in Operations Research, and MBA from Stanford University. Pioneer of multi-club ownership in European football, with stakes in clubs including Barnsley FC, OGC Nice, FC Kaiserslautern, and others. Previously worked at Morgan Stanley (NYC) and Price Waterhouse (SF). Also co-founded 7 Days Inn.
ngos: Stanford Board of Trustees (former); Stanford Alumni Association (Board); Stanford GSB Advisory Council

name: Lerer, Joseph S.
title: Angel Investor and Co-Founder
notes: San Francisco-based angel investor focused on SaaS model technologies. Co-founder of FORENSIC LOGIC (law enforcement analytics company). Prior roles include work with KUHUSU, City Bridge, Laguna Honda Hospital, and the Coast Guard Foundation.
ngos: Coast Guard Foundation (former)

name: Luther, Homer L. Jr.
employer: Private investor / Eagle Management and Trust Company (former)
title: Private Investor; Former Founder and Chair, Eagle Management and Trust
notes: Texas-based private investor with BA and MBA (Accounting) from University of Texas and MBA from Harvard. Served on special diplomatic assignments for Presidents Nixon and Ford to 25+ countries. Founded Eagle Management and Trust Company, which managed several billion in assets before its sale to Guinness Peat Ltd. of London. Early investor in major tech companies. Vice Chair of Houston Host Committee for the 1992 Republican National Convention.
ngos: University of Texas Investment Management Company (Director); various Republican civic committees
political_donations: Republican donor; advisor to George H.W. Bush 1988 presidential campaign; Director of Special Events for 1988 Republican Convention; Director of Events for 1990 G7 Economic Summit.

name: Merrill, Steven L.
employer: Merrill, Pickard, Anderson & Eyre (MPAE) / Benchmark Capital (co-founder)
title: Co-Founder and General Partner (retired)
notes: Born and raised in San Francisco. BA from Stanford University, MBA from the Wharton School (1967). President of BankAmerica Capital Corporation (1976-1980), then founded Merrill, Pickard, Anderson & Eyre (MPAE), a pioneering Silicon Valley VC partnership. Helped co-found Benchmark Capital. Past President of the Western Association of Venture Capitalists and past director of the National Venture Capital Association.
ngos: Keep Tahoe Blue / League to Save Lake Tahoe (board); UCSF Foundation (board member, elected 2006); Tahoe Fund (board)

name: Pelosi, Laurence
title: Senior Managing Director, Renewable Energy Development
notes: Nephew of former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi. BA in Political Science from UC Berkeley, JD from Georgetown Law. Co-leads Crow Holdings Renewables (joined 2019). Over 20 years in real estate; prior roles include Executive Director at Morgan Stanley Real Estate, Director of Acquisitions at Lennar Communities, and partnerships with Goldman Sachs Urban Investment Group and Tricon Residential.

name: Peterson, Richard H. Jr.
title: Founder / Private Investor
notes: Son of Richard H. Peterson Sr. (former Chairman of PG&E's Board). Based in San Francisco Bay Area. Runs a diversified investment portfolio including real estate, retail, and technology investments. Recorded $36,400 in California state political contributions through December 2024.
political_donations: $36,400 in total California state political contributions through 12/31/2024 per Transparency USA.

name: Pickford, Stephen T.
title: Registered Agent / Executive
notes: Stephen T. Pickford served as registered agent for The Corporate Staff, Inc., incorporated August 27, 1984, located at 177 Bovet Road, Suite 600, San Mateo, California. Limited additional public biographical information found.

name: Rolfe, Stuart T.
title: President and Owner
notes: Seattle-based hotel executive and attorney. Chairman and CEO of the Space Needle Corporation (1990-1998); before that, Corporate Counsel for Washington Mutual Bank and partner at Seattle law firm Foster Pepper and Shefelman. Wright Hotels manages properties including the Sheraton Seattle and Cedarbrook Lodge. Married into the Wright family (Seattle's Space Needle-owning real estate dynasty). BA from Dartmouth College; JD from Seattle University.
ngos: Seattle University Board of Trustees (2001-2015, served as Chair of Finance/Investment/Facilities Committees); Orcas Island Chamber Music Festival (Board)

name: Ruprecht, David Martin
title: Actor, Game Show Host; former Executive Director, Libertarian Party of California
notes: Born October 14, 1948 in St. Louis, MO. Known as host of Supermarket Sweep (Lifetime/PAX, 1990-2003). Guest-starred in over 50 TV shows including Three's Company and True Blood. Joined the Libertarian Party at its 2000 National Convention in Anaheim; served as Executive Director of the Libertarian Party of California starting October 2004. Long-time member of Rotary International.
ngos: Rotary International (member); Libertarian Party of California (former Executive Director)
political_donations: Libertarian Party; joined LP at 2000 National Convention in Anaheim, CA.

name: Rush, R. Stockton III
title: Co-Founder and CEO (deceased)
notes: Richard Stockton Rush III (March 31, 1962 – June 18, 2023). Princeton University graduate; worked as flight test engineer at McDonnell Douglas (F-15 program). Co-founded OceanGate, Inc. in 2009. Died when OceanGate's submersible Titan imploded on June 18, 2023 during a descent to the Titanic wreck. A 2025 U.S. Coast Guard report found Rush 'exhibited negligence' contributing to the deaths of all five aboard.
political_donations: Republican donor; contributions to Culberson for Congress and Dino Rossi (WA state GOP candidate) among others.

name: Skinner, Paul W.

notes: No specific public professional biography located for a Paul W. Skinner definitively linked to the Bohemian Club's Ye Merrie Yowls camp.

name: Stephens, Robert L.
title: Unknown
notes: No specific public professional biography located for a Robert L. Stephens definitively linked to the Bohemian Club's Ye Merrie Yowls camp.

name: Stull, David H.
title: President
notes: Native of Cincinnati; tuba performance and English literature degrees from Oberlin College, MM from University of Wisconsin-Madison. Appointed SFCM President in 2013. Oversaw completion of the $200M+ Bowes Center for Performing Arts. Led SFCM acquisitions of Opus 3 Artists, Pentatone, and Askonas Holt (2020-2022). Previously Dean of Oberlin Conservatory for nine years. Named to Musical America's Top 30 Professionals.
ngos: San Francisco Symphony (Advisory Relationship); SFCM Board of Trustees (President)

name: Bajpai, Jayanti Shankar
title: Unknown

name: Beck, Bill
title: Unknown

name: Bullard, Edward Dickinson
title: Former Chairman
notes: Known as 'Jed' Bullard; Harvard Business School MBA (1975). Great-grandson of E.D. Bullard Company founder Edward W. Bullard, who invented the hard hat. During his 25-year tenure as Chairman in Cynthiana, KY, grew the company to $50M annual sales. The Bullard family founded the company in San Francisco in 1898 before relocating to Kentucky in 1972.
ngos: Harvard Business School Alumni Board (Former Member)

name: Cahill, Edward Lyons
title: Orthopedic Surgeon
notes: Board-certified orthopedic surgeon in Stockton, CA with over 45 years of practice. Graduated from USC Keck School of Medicine (1979). Affiliated with Dameron Hospital, St. Joseph's Medical Center Stockton, and other Central Valley hospitals. Served as Chief of Orthopaedic Surgery at Dameron Hospital and St. Joseph's Medical Center and as Chief of Staff at Dameron Hospital.

name: Clack, David A.
title: Unknown
notes: No specific public professional biography found for a David A. Clack definitively linked to the Bohemian Club's Friends of the Forest camp. A David A. Clack served as chairman and CEO of Old National Bancorporation of Spokane, Washington (not California-based).

name: Cooley, Robert A.
title: Unknown
notes: No specific public professional biography located for Robert A. Cooley definitively linked to the Bohemian Club's Friends of the Forest camp. A Robert L. Cooley, AIA, is a licensed architect in San Francisco; other California-based Robert Cooleys work in renewable energy and higher education.

name: Dillon, David
employer: Great Range Capital / The Kroger Co. (retired)
title: Former Chairman and CEO, Kroger; Advisor, Great Range Capital
notes: Born March 30, 1951. Led Kroger as CEO (2003-2013) and Chairman (2004-2014). During his tenure as CEO, Kroger grew revenue by $45 billion and created 53,000 jobs. Now serves as an advisor to Great Range Capital and on several corporate boards. JD from University of Kansas School of Law.
ngos: University of Kansas Endowment (Board of Trustees); MRIGlobal (Board); Kansas Nature Conservancy (Board)

name: Domann, William A. Jr.
title: Founder and Principal
notes: Founded The Domann Organization in San Francisco in 1988; one of the first executive search firms focused exclusively on Life Sciences leadership. Based in Rancho Santa Fe, CA. Serves biotech and pharmaceutical companies recruiting executive and board-level talent. Previous executive recruitment experience prior to founding his own firm.
ngos: BioForward (Board Member, 2014-2016); The Guardsmen-San Francisco (Past President, 1992-1993); San Francisco Boys & Girls Club (former board); Northern California Arthritis Foundation (former board)

name: Ferdon, Jonathan
title: Attorney (Wills and Trusts)
notes: Jonathan Riordan Ferdon is a San Francisco estate planning attorney licensed for 48 years (California Bar No. 74382). Office at 50 California Street, Suite 1500, San Francisco, CA 94111. Attended Lincoln University for his legal education. Specializes in wills, trusts, and estate planning.

name: Gaither, H. Rowan III
title: Partner, Litigation
notes: Litigation partner at Perkins Coie LLP with over 20 years of experience in complex commercial cases involving financial benchmarks, securities, derivatives, commodities, and other sophisticated financial products. Harvard Law School JD (1995 class). Previously an Associate at Cravath, Swaine & Moore and a judicial law clerk. Selected to Super Lawyers 2013-2025. Son of a prominent Gaither family with deep San Francisco legal/financial roots.

name: Gaither, James C.
title: Managing Director, Sutter Hill Ventures; Special Counsel, Cooley LLP (retired)
notes: Born September 3, 1937. Stanford Law JD (1964); clerked for Chief Justice Earl Warren on the Warren Commission. Staff assistant to President Lyndon Johnson. Partner at Cooley Godward (1971-2000; managing partner 1984-1990). Managing Director of Sutter Hill Ventures since 2000. Fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences. Stanford Board of Trustees Chairman (1982-1992).
ngos: Carnegie Endowment for International Peace (Chairman of Board, 2003+; board member 1981-1999); James Irvine Foundation (Chairman); Stanford Board of Trustees (former Chair)

name: Gaither, James Castle Jr.
title: President
notes: Son of James C. Gaither (Sutter Hill Ventures). Involved in real estate development and nature conservation. President of Castle Wells Company. Also connected to sustainable development and the Getting to Zero Forum (energy policy).
ngos: Getting to Zero Forum (Speaker/Participant)

name: Gille, Thomas Wm.
title: Founder and Principal
notes: Thomas Gille founded REAL Systems in San Francisco in 1996, a consulting firm for commercial real estate management. Over 30 years of experience in commercial real estate. Prior roles: COO at CAC Real Estate Management (acquired by CBRE in 2013), VP of Asset Management at Catellus Development Corporation. MS in Management (Sloan Fellow) from London Business School; BS in Organizational Behavior from University of San Francisco. Honored as BOMA Fellow (inaugural class, 2012).

name: Grether, John M.
title: Attorney
notes: John Moffatt Grether is a California-licensed attorney based in Somis, CA (4049 Walnut Ave). Educated at UC Berkeley Boalt Hall School of Law. Limited public biographical information beyond bar licensure.

name: Howard, James Newton
title: Film Composer
notes: Born June 9, 1951. Attended USC music school before touring with Elton John as keyboardist. Has scored over 100 major films including Pretty Woman (1990), The Fugitive (1993), The Sixth Sense (1999), Batman Begins and The Dark Knight (2005/2008, with Hans Zimmer), and The Hunger Games franchise (2012-2023). Grammy winner for The Dark Knight score; nine Academy Award nominations. ASCAP Henry Mancini Award and BMI Lifetime Achievement Award recipient.
ngos: Los Angeles Chamber Orchestra (Honorary Chair; LACO commissioned world premiere of his Concerto for Cello & Orchestra, 2019)

name: Huggins, Charles C. (Chip)
title: Founder and Principal
notes: Seasoned nonprofit sector leader with over 38 years of experience based in San Jose, CA. Previous roles include President & CEO of Hope Services (intellectual/developmental disabilities), CEO of Caminar, and CEO of Second Harvest Food Bank. From 1980-2002 worked at See's Candies, ending as General Manager/Director of Purchasing; later President and CEO of Joseph Schmidt Confections until 2005. Stanford BA (business administration), JD from John F. Kennedy University, BS in Finance from Menlo College.
ngos: Peninsula Community Foundation (board); Boys & Girls Clubs of San Francisco (board); Coyote Point Museum (board)

name: Leveroni, Stephen E.
title: Executive Vice President and Founding Principal
notes: Fourth-generation San Franciscan with over 40 years in the banking and insurance industries. Co-founded one of the Bay Area's largest independent insurance brokerages, later merged with ABD Insurance and Newfront. Previously held management and lending positions with Columbus Savings and Loan, Redwood Bank, and Hibernia Bank. Appointed by Mayor Breed to the San Francisco Public Utilities Commission (Seat 3, term ending August 1, 2028).
ngos: San Francisco Public Utilities Commission (Commissioner, Vice President); Italian Community Services (President of the Board); Italian Heritage Parade (Chair of the Board); Salesian Boys and Girls Club (fundraising leadership)

name: Milligan, Marshall C.
employer: Bank of A. Levy / First Interstate Bank (retired)
title: Former President and CEO, Bank of A. Levy
notes: Born November 9, 1951 in Oxnard, CA. BA from Yale University (1973), MBA from Stanford (1976). Great-grandson of bank founder Achille Levy. Took over Bank of A. Levy leadership in 1982 along with his brother Michael. Led the bank until its sale to First Interstate Bank for $86.5 million in 1994 (17 branches, 65,000 accounts). Also served as a trustee of the Real Estate Investment Trust of California in Santa Monica. Now based in Santa Barbara.
ngos: Real Estate Investment Trust of California (Trustee, 1982+); Montecito Bank & Trust (former Director)

name: Monfredini, Martin Emil
title: Vice President
notes: South San Francisco-based executive (known as 'Marty') at Pacific Agri-Products, Inc., an agricultural products company. Member of the Monfredini family with long ties to the South San Francisco area. Limited additional public biographical information found.

name: Newman, Paul
title: N/A (deceased September 26, 2008)
notes: NOTE: Paul Newman the actor (January 26, 1925 – September 26, 2008) passed away before the membership list was compiled. This listing may be historical, or it may refer to a different person with the same name. Paul Newman the actor was renowned for films including Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid, The Sting, and The Color of Money (Academy Award). He co-founded Newman's Own food company, donating all after-tax profits to charity (over $570 million to date). He also co-founded the Hole in the Wall Gang Camp for seriously ill children.
ngos: Newman's Own Foundation (co-founder); Hole in the Wall Gang Camp (co-founder); Scott Newman Center (founder)
political_donations: Democratic donor and activist; supported Democratic candidates throughout his career.

name: Olds, William Lee III
title: Unknown
notes: Son of William Lee Olds Jr., who was President of the William G. Irwin Charity Foundation and a founding board member of University High School in San Francisco. William Lee Olds III is based in San Francisco; no specific professional employer or title confirmed in public sources.

name: Parks, Larry D.
title: Unknown

name: Podesta, Robert Anthony
title: Principal; President
notes: San Francisco-based executive serving as Principal at Podesta & Co. and President at Fisher Development, Inc., a San Francisco construction and real estate development company. University of Notre Dame alumnus. Over 35 years of experience in real estate and construction development in the Bay Area.

name: Rantz, Michael G.
employer: Fortress Investment Group LLC (former) / Private investor
title: Former Director, Fortress Investment Group; Former Partner, Goldman Sachs
notes: Cornell University undergraduate, University of Chicago MBA. Joined Goldman Sachs in 1983, became partner in 1992; responsible for global government bond trading in London (1995-1999). Co-founded BrokerTec Global LLC. Appointed to Fortress Investment Group Board of Directors in July 2015. Based in Palo Alto, CA. Also operates the Michael and Paula Rantz Foundation.
ngos: The Michael and Paula Rantz Foundation (co-founder)

name: Read, Steven M.
title: Owner and Partner
notes: Berkeley, CA-based real estate developer; principal of Read Investments, a real estate development company and family office (since 1990). Currently a Trustee of the United States Olympic and Paralympic Committee. Previously served on the board of Grocery Outlet.
ngos: United States Olympic and Paralympic Committee (Trustee); Grocery Outlet (former Board Member)

name: Rees, W. Mason
title: Former Chief Operating Officer
notes: Former COO at Trident Global. The Rees family has historic connections to The Chubb Corporation (W. Mason Rees of Rye, NY was son of former Chubb Chairman William Rees, 1970-1981). Limited additional public biographical details confirmed.

name: Richart, Ralph M.
employer: Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons / International Isotopes Inc.
title: Professor Emeritus of Pathology; Former Chairman of the Board, International Isotopes
notes: Professor emeritus in the Department of Pathology at Columbia University (faculty 1963-2006). First elected to the Board of International Isotopes (INIS) in January 2002; elected Chairman of the Board in April 2002. From 1972 to 2006, served as CEO of several privately held companies in medicine and electronics. Has served on corporate medical advisory boards and consulted for FDA on clinical trials. Age approximately 79 at time of INIS board service.

name: Rocha, Steven A.
title: Senior Vice President and Senior Financial Advisor
notes: Joined Merrill Lynch's San Francisco office in 1980; registered with Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith since February 1981. UC Berkeley graduate with BA in Economics. Senior VP and Senior Financial Advisor operating The Rocha Group in San Francisco, CA. Registered to do business in 15 states.

title: Principal
